author: thomas-illiet
body:
Hi All.

I use Jenkins to build / test my Powershell modules, I would like to create virtual environments to separate dependencies from my projects ( Like Python Virtualenv )

Actualy i create a litle module for this : https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/Virtualenv/

could we have an integration of this feature in powershell ?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@thomas-illiet Could you please add more information/scenarios? Can this help to isolate different version dll-s like Newton.Json used in PowerShell engine and in custom modules?

/cc @SteveL-MSFT @daxian-dbw

comments.author: thomas-illiet
comments.body:
Hello @iSazonov :)

## Scenarios

For example I have a lot of scripts with the same module with breaking changes. I do not want to specify the version of the module in the script.

Another example, in Visual Studio the libraries are not installed in the system because it is in the project (
